business.headline: Indian Overseas Bank rolls out Aadhaar-based account opening. Check detailsThis new initiative allows customers to open savings bank accounts online with minimal documentation, as per Reserve Bank of India's eKYC guidelines.

Sensex, Nifty tumble again as volatility grips Dalal Street. 3 things to knowStock Market Today, 18 Feb 2025: Dalal Street remains under pressure with no immediate relief in sight. Here are some key points investors should know.

Tesla eyes India entry for third time. Why EV giant's last two attempts failedTesla in India: Tesla has made two previous attempts to enter the Indian market, both of which ended in failure.  Here's a look at the reasons behind its past setbacks.
Tesla begins hiring in India: Here's the list of job openings and locationsTesla India hiring: Tesla has posted 13 job openings on its LinkedIn page, covering both customer-facing and back-end roles.

Sensex, Nifty open lower despite IT stock gains; metal, banking dragShare Market: The S&P BSE Sensex lost 105.42 points to 75,891.44, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 57.15 points to 22,902.35 as of 9:30 AM.

Tesla hints at India entry with jobs post days after PM Modi meets Elon MuskTesla has begun hiring in India and has posted several job openings. This comes shortly after Tesla CEO Elon Musk met with Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his recent visit to the US.

Dalal Street continues to be volatile: What should investors do? Dalal Street volatile: The S&P BSE Sensex gained 57.65 points to settle at 75,996.86, while the NSE Nifty50 added 30.25 points to close at 22,959.50. Despite this recovery, overall market sentiment remains cautious as investors react to various global and domestic factors.

How a change of name caused Bira a loss of Rs 80 crore. Check details Ahead of its IPO, B9 Beverages Private Ltd, the owner of Bira beer, changed its name to B9 Beverages Ltd, causing several compliance hurdles and sales disruptions.

New Income Tax Bill: 10 FAQs you should knowNew Income Tax Bill 2025 explained: The current income tax bill which was enacted in 1961, and came into effect in 1962, consisted of 512,535 words and 819 sections. On the contrary, the new bill consists of 259,676 words, 23 chapters and 536 sections.
Sensex, Nifty recover losses to end marginally higher amid volatilityThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 57.65 points to close at 75,996.86, while the NSE Nifty50 added 30.25 points to end at 22,959.50.

Regulatory body warns against rising NPS scams, issues these guidelines The Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) has cautioned subscribers of the National Pension Scheme (NPS) and Atal Pension Yojayna (APY) regarding fraudulent calls demanding money to release pension funds.

Government may set up reserve fund for stable EPFO interest rates: ReportThe labour and employment ministry is conducting an internal study to explore the creation of an interest stabilisation reserve fund under the EPFO, sources said familiar with the matter.

entertainment.headline: Karan Singh Grover back on TV 5 years after Kasautii Zindagii Kay: ReportActor Karan Singh Grover might just be a part of a romantic show very soon. He is reported to be seen alongside Helly Shah in this new TV show.

Late Linkin Park singer Chester Bennington's child comes out as transgenderLinkin Park singer Chester Bennington's child, Draven, has come out as transgender. The artiste shared the news on her social media handle, while stating her preferred pronouns in a small note.

Amit Trivedi: Global artists performing in India is nothing but pure businessIndia has become a hotspot for global artists to perform, drawing big names like Coldplay, Ed Sheeran, and Dua Lipa. Music composer Amit Trivedi believes their choice is driven by business interests, as they seek lucrative opportunities in the country.

Bridgerton 4 first look: Benedict-Sophie's love story takes centre stageThe fourth season of Bridgerton is set to spotlight Benedict Bridgerton's romance with Sophie Baek. New characters like Katie Leung's Lady Araminta Gun will add intrigue to the season.

Legends of Shiva: Amish Tripathi gets real about Lord Shiva in his latest showAuthor and producer Amish Tripathi returns as host of Legends of Shiva with Amish, a new show on Discovery Channel, exploring Lord Shiva beyond myths. Unveiled at the New Delhi Book Fair, it promises a deep dive into mythology coinciding with Maha Kumbh 2025.

Amortage review: Jisoo's album shakes things up like an 'earthquake'Jisoo's new EP, Amortage, released on February 14, 2025, marks her evolution as a solo artist. The EP blends pop and R&B to explore love's many facets, featuring English tracks and her own songwriting.

Bhabiji writer Manoj Santoshi battles cancer, Shilpa Shinde takes care of himActor Kavita Kaushik made an emotional post on social media, highlighting screenwriter Manoj Santoshi's struggle with liver cancer. She also mentioned actor Shilpa Shinde and thanked her for taking care of him.

The Witch review: Jinyoung, Jeong-eui shine in slow-burning psychological mysteryReleased-Sat Feb 15, 2025The Witch review: The Witch, a new K-drama starring Jinyoung and Jeong-eui, captivates with its psychological mystery and slow-burning narrative. The series, based on a popular webtoon, blends mystery, romance, and suspense, leaving viewers intrigued by the enigmatic characters and their complex interactions, says our review.

Rashami Desai on love-hate bond with Sidharth Shukla: We'd communicate through eyesActor Rashami Desai, who had worked with the late Sidharth Shukla on 'Dil Se Dil Tak' and 'Bigg Boss 13', was reminded of her relationship with him on comedian Bharti Singh's podcast.

Stray Kids' Felix suffers fracture after car accident, misses group's fan meetFelix, a member of the boy band Stray Kids, suffered an arm fracture in a minor car accident, causing him to miss the band's fifth fan meeting.

South Korean actor Kim Sae-ron wanted to make a comeback to films, open a cafeSouth Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, who was found dead in her apartment on Sunday, had wished to make a comeback to the entertainment world, revealed a friend recently.

Gajraj Rao, Renuka Shahane's Dupahiya to bring laughter and chaos to Prime VideoPrime Video's Dupahiya is set in a crime-free village where the first-ever theft of a motorbike creates chaos and drama. Starring Gajraj Rao and Renuka Shahane, the comedy series starts streaming on March 7.

general news.headline: Supreme Court shields Ranveer Allahbadia from arrest, says no shows for nowThe Supreme Court granted relief to YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia from being arrested over his obscene joke on 'India's Got Latent' show, but roasted him over his remarks, saying his "perverted mind made the entire society feel ashamed".
Odisha college apologises, suspends 2 staffers amid Nepali student's suicide rowComments made in heat of moment: KIIT suspends 2 hostel officials amid row over Nepali student's suicide

Vomited dirt in his mind: Supreme Court roasts Ranveer Allahbadia over jokeThe Supreme Court pulled up Ranveer Allahbadia while hearing his plea over FIRs filed against him in connection with the row over an obscene joke on India Got Latent show.

Trump's $500 billion Ukraine payback exceeds German war reparations: ReportThe US has offered a USD 500 billion deal for war-hit Ukraine, allowing it to have exclusive access to the European country's rare earth minerals, oil and gas production, and its ports and other-related infrastructure.

Amid H-1B visa backlash, a look at other US work visa optionsThe H-1B visa remains the most popular choice among American work visas for Indians. However, the H-1B visa system is facing scrutiny after Donald Trump's return as the US President. Here are the lesser-known work visa categories, like H-2A, H-2B, H-3, L, O, P, Q, and R visas, that offer opportunities to work in the US.

Tesla hints at India entry with jobs post days after PM Modi meets Elon MuskTesla has begun hiring in India and has posted several job openings. This comes shortly after Tesla CEO Elon Musk met with Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his recent visit to the US.

Security of 20 Shinde Sena MLAs slashed as Mahayuti tussle intensifies: SourcesThe Y-security cover for these 20 MLAs was provided after their defection from the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena in 2022, which eventually led to the fall of the Maha Vikas Aghadi government.

Born at the 'right' time: The growing craze for Mahurat Deliveries in IndiaMahurat delivery craze in India: More and more people are opting for Mahurat Deliveries, believing that in an uncertain world, they can influence their baby's fate and ensure an 'auspicious', 'blessed' future.

Two students use Fortuner, BMW to do 'donuts' on Hyderabad road, arrestedThe police arrested two students for performing reckless stunts in a BMW SUV and a Toyota Fortuner on Hyderabad's Outer Ring Road. The two were taken into custody after CCTV footage helped the police track them down.

'Perverted mind, dirty': Supreme Court talks tough on Ranveer Allahbadia caseThe Supreme Court, however, granted YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia protection from arrest and directed him to cooperate in the investigation.

Viral video: Comic Gaurav Kapoor roasts YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia over apologyComedian Gaurav Kapoor, cashing in on the controversy, joked about Ranveer Allahbadia in his recent stand-up comedy special. He said that Ranveer's apology came just two hours after the controversy.

'Papa killed mummy': 4-year-old's drawing leads UP cops to arrest man for murderA 27-year-old woman was found dead under suspicious circumstances in Jhansi, with her family accusing her husband and in-laws of murder. The woman's 4-year-old daughter accused her father of killing her mother by hanging her.

DeepSeek to meet TikTok's fate? Why countries are banning the ChatGPT challengerThe data privacy and security concerns raised over DeepSeek use and the ban that followed in South Korea and other countries echoes the fate that TikTok, another Chinese app, met in several countries.

'It's upside down': Plane flips on landing at Canada airport, 18 injuredCanada plane crash: A Delta Air Lines plane flipped upside down upon landing at Canada's Toronto Pearson Airport on Monday, injuring 18 of the 80 people on board.

India bowling coach Morne Morkel returns home due to family emergencyChampions Trophy: India bowling coach Morne Morkel has rushed out of Dubai due to a family emergency. Morkel left for South Africa after his father Albert passed away. Morkel was expected to play a crucial part in guiding India's bowling attack in the absence of Jasprit Bumrah.

40-minute delay in Delhi stampede response? What Railways, fire officials sayNDLS Stampede: The stampede at the New Delhi railway station was triggered due to an announcement that a special Kumbh train would arrive at platform 16 after an earlier announcement that it would come on platform 12, triggering confusion among passengers, an RPF report said.

Fan arrives on horseback to watch Chhaava, shouts 'Jai Bhavani' in theatreA Nagpur man, dressed as Sambhaji Maharaj, arrived on horseback to watch Chhaava, chanting slogans in the theatre. Vicky Kaushal's film has sparked massive fan celebrations, crossing Rs 100 crore at the box office.

Meet new poll body chief Gyanesh Kumar: Ex-bureaucrat, key player in J&K reformsGyanesh Kumar, a 1988-batch Kerala cadre IAS officer, was appointed India's 26th Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) and his term will run till January 26, 2029.

The quiet struggle of growing up Hindu in US, and why silence is no more an optionHindus in the US have long been told we are "the good immigrants", but it is a double-edged sword. The people who praise us as hard-working immigrants turn on us when we become too successful. We must own our identity, and make it clear that we are stakeholders in America's future, and aren't going anywhere.

Amit Trivedi: Global artists performing in India is nothing but pure businessIndia has become a hotspot for global artists to perform, drawing big names like Coldplay, Ed Sheeran, and Dua Lipa. Music composer Amit Trivedi believes their choice is driven by business interests, as they seek lucrative opportunities in the country.

High level of faecal bacteria in Ganga at Prayagraj as millions take Kumbh dipThe National Green Tribunal (NGT) has raised concerns about rising faecal bacteria levels in the Ganga at Prayagraj, especially during the Maha Kumbh Mela.

First glimpse of India's Champions Trophy jersey, features 'Pakistan' imprintThe Indian cricket team unveiled their new jersey for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 which interestingly has the hosts' Pakistan name printed on it.

Punjab woman's murder solved, AAP leader husband caught for hiring killersLudhiana Police arrested AAP leader Anokh Mittal and his girlfriend, accusing them of hiring contract killers to murder Mittal's wife. According to the police, the AAP leader agreed to pay Rs 2.5 lakh for the crime, with Rs 50,000 paid in advance.
The Odyssey: Matt Damon's first look poster from Christopher Nolan's film outMatt Damon plays the Odysseus in Christopher Nolan's The Odyssey. The first-look poster of the film was unveiled recently.

Akshay Kumar sings Mahakal Chalo, a tribute to Lord Shiva, ahead of Maha ShivratriAkshay Kumar releases his new single Mahakal Chalo ahead of Maha Shivratri. Palash Sen is also a part of the song. Akshay will also portray Lord Shiva in Kannappa, set to release on April 25.

Late Linkin Park singer Chester Bennington's child comes out as transgenderLinkin Park singer Chester Bennington's child, Draven, has come out as transgender. The artiste shared the news on her social media handle, while stating her preferred pronouns in a small note.

Sunny Deol starts shooting for Border 2 with Varun Dhawan in JhansiUpcoming Movie Border 2: Actor Sunny Deol has joined the team of 'Border 2' with Varun Dhawan and others in Jhansi, Madhya Pradesh. The team shared a photo online on Tuesday.

Rakul Preet on getting inspired by actors: I called Alia Bhatt after GangubaiActor Rakul Preet Singh praises Alia Bhatt's Gangubai Kathiawadi and Kriti Sanon's Mimi, expressing her desire to play strong roles. She also hopes to do a historical film and a passionate love story.

sports.headline: Mission 90m is on: Neeraj Chopra on how legend Zelezny is moulding his techniqueDouble Olympic medallist Neeraj Chopra is working with his new coach Jan Zelezny. The legendary former javelin star has been working on correcting Neeraj's technique post the Paris Olympics.

Champions Trophy: New Zealand name Jamieson as Lockie Ferguson replacementNew Zealand suffered another setback as Lockie Ferguson was ruled out of the Champions Trophy due to injury, with Kyle Jamieson named as his replacement. The Black Caps now await further updates on Rachin Ravindra's fitness.

Watch: Rohit featured in his 17th ICC photoshoot, wows Jadeja and GillIndia captain Rohit Sharma stunned teammates Ravindra Jadeja and Shubman Gill as he recalled his 17 ICC tournament appearances ahead of the Champions Trophy, highlighting his immense experience and impressive record in global events.

India bowling coach Morne Morkel returns home due to family emergencyChampions Trophy: India bowling coach Morne Morkel has rushed out of Dubai due to a family emergency. Morkel left for South Africa after his father Albert passed away. Morkel was expected to play a crucial part in guiding India's bowling attack in the absence of Jasprit Bumrah.

Hosting CWG would be a stepping stone for India's Olympic Dream: CGF CEO SadlierCommonwealth Games Federation CEO Katie Sadleir has said that hosting the CWG 2030 would be the right step in India's hope of hosting the Olympics. India have formally submitted the bid for the 2036 Games and hope to host the event across multiple cities.

Watch: Rohit, Kohli relax after nets, Shami signs autographs for fansIndia skipper Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli were spotted unwinding after a training session in Dubai ahead of the Champions Trophy, while pacer Mohammed Shami delighted fans by taking time to sign autographs.

Mary Kom presents Manu Bhaker with BBC Sportswoman of the year awardIndian boxing legend Mary Kom presented the BBC Indian Sportswoman of the Year award to Paris Olympics shooting sensation Manu Bhaker on February 17, honouring her remarkable achievements, including two historic bronze medals at the Games, solidifying her legacy in Indian sports.

Virat Kohli will perform like a champion: Childhood coach backs India starChampions Trophy: Virat Kohli's childhood coach, Rajkumar Sharma, has dismissed concerns over the star batter's form, backing him to deliver a "champion" performance in the upcoming Champions Trophy despite recent struggles in international cricket.

Novak Djokovic calls out 'favouritism' shown in Jannik Sinner doping banNovak Djokovic slammed WADA for showing "favouritism" in Jannik Sinner's doping case, criticising the lenient three-month ban that allows the World No.1 to compete in Grand Slams, calling it unfair treatment compared to other doping cases.

Why vice-captain Shubman Gill will be India's MVP in Champions TrophyVice-captain Shubman Gill has stepped up in ODIs for India in a big way in the past few years and could prove to be India's MVP during the upcoming Champions Trophy in Dubai.

Manu Bhaker named BBC Sportswoman of the YearManu Bhaker, India's shooting sensation, won the BBC Indian Sportswoman of the Year after securing two historic bronze medals at the Paris Olympics, becoming the first Indian female shooter to achieve multiple Olympic podium finishes.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
